statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Demario Beck had 20 points and 13 rebounds to lead Coastal Carolina to a 100-63 rout over Piedmont International on Monday night.
article.headline: Coastal Carolina puts Piedmont away early in 100-63 rout
article.linkText: Coastal Carolina puts Piedmont away early in 100-63 rout
article.story: CONWAY, S.C. -- Demario Beck had 20 points and 13 rebounds to lead Coastal Carolina to a 100-63 rout over Piedmont International on Monday night. Beck finished 6 of 8 from the field, including 3 of 3 from long range, and 5 of 6 at the line. Elijah Wilson added 16 points and Jaylen Shaw had 11 points and eight assists for the Chanticleers (4-6), who shot 49.3 percent from the field and hit 10 3s. Coastal Carolina, which topped 100 points twice last season, beat Piedmont 116-35 on Nov. 21, 2015. Nash Carter scored 19 points and David Barron added 18 to lead Piedmont, which was held to just 30.8 percent shooting and lost the rebounding battle 56-34. Shaw drilled a 3-pointer 23 seconds into the game and the Chanticleers never looked back, building a 51-21 halftime lead. Beck nailed a 3 to push the lead past 40 (65-24) with 15:22 left.
